title: Localize Yoroi for Ukraine
description: Yoroi is currently lacking Ukrainian interface, making in difficult to access for the broader local public.

f6_assessments.q0: Great small project to localize Yoroi wallet for Ukraine. These types of localizations are imperative for Cardano to be successful across the world.
f6_assessments.q1: This is a simple low cost plan. There is no reason to believe the developers cannot deliver upon it.
f6_assessments.q2: Simple plan, deliver the Ukrainian localization. Progress easy to audit. Success could be measured afterwards by the number of downloads / usages of the localized app.

f6_assessments.q0: Expanding accessibility to other languages supports everyone
f6_assessments.q1: There is enough here and the task is precise and small enough to make me confident this will be completed
f6_assessments.q2: The year of maintenance is a good aspect because this is a quickly changing piece of software. There is enough here to make me believe it will succeed

f6_assessments.q0: Making a significant part of the Cardano ecosystem, as Yoroi is, more readily and easily accessible to non-English speakers is always an integral part of adoption. It can help on-board more people, more quickly. I am aware of the two previously funded proposals mentioned & it is only logical to solve this problem for the 2nd largest European nation, as claimed. That said, it would have been more helpful if statistics & demographics were presented such as the uptake of cryptocurrency and specifically Cardano in the country, if there are current Ukraine-based user groups & SPOs who are already a part of the ecosystem, and marketing efforts in English/Ukrainian resources. This would have painted a picture of the immediacy of this solution, and gained a higher score than provided.
f6_assessments.q1: Unfortunately, there are not enough credentials and skills presented to provide a high level of confidence that this solution can be achieved. Merely stating belief in Cardano as a Ukrainian speaker does not translate well for proposals seeking funding. It would have been helpful if the proposer identified him/herself and the team of software developers with links to previous projects completed or linkedin profiles. The budget sought is relatively small compared to other proposals but nonetheless, without a carefully laid out plan on how the translation process will be conducted, the time it will take and how the amount will be spent, gives the impression that there is nothing concrete yet. At least nothing to go by to properly assess its viability and level of success.
f6_assessments.q2: The success of this solution would have been easy to identify, i.e. there would have been a Ukrainian option at the apps startup. However and as stated earlier, there's not enough information provided in order to properly assess its viability much less its audibility. The aim of the proposal is not in question nor the amount of funding sought. What's missing are the critical elements of who the proposer is, their relevant experiences to tackle this challenge and an itemised development plan that could be checked at each step of the way to its final completion. I would encourage the proposer to resubmit this proposal with more pertinent details at a later funding round.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal could understand the importance of the Yoroi's wallet traduction  for the adoption of the Cardano ecosystem globally.  However, is limited the information about the skilsl or experience of the proposers for implement the proposal.
f6_assessments.q1:
-	The proposer mention relevant skills and experience of the team in charge of the proposal but not provide references or links for check that information.  The proposal does not provided specific details about the team in charge of the implementation.

-	 The proposer does not provide a budget clearly outline and broken down into identifiable items.

-	The proposer does not provide a sensible and conductible plan for implementation that shows not only what is being done but also how.

-	The plan does not describe the resources necessary to implement the proposal. 

-	The proposal does not clearly explain technical aspects like architecture, language and tecnologies if they are crucial for implementation

-	The proposer has not considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation.
f6_assessments.q2:
-	The proposal does not provided a roadmap with milestones for the follow-up of the proposal.

-	The proposer does not present metrics/KPIs that define the success of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: It is important to note that bridging language barriers in the ecosystem is welcome ideas because it increases adoption of the ecosystem by  developers and users alike.
f6_assessments.q1:
There is no detailed profile of the team's experience and/or past achievements. This will really convince that the proposal is in goods.

Also there is no breakdown of plans and budget on how to deliver this project eventually. More details is required in regards to execution.
f6_assessments.q2: There is no criteria to monitor and assess the performance of this project. There is no way to determine be what the success will be.

solution: We will translate the whole Yoroi interface in Ukrainian and contribute the content to the Open Source project in GitHub.
experience: We are an international software development team currently working in a freelance manner, with experience in various technological domains.
